page.title: 03Durie House 2
page.content: After he was taken to England he presented all the officers on the shipwith a minature portrait of himself, painted on bone. Around the early 18th century when there was a great demand for coal and when coal was discovered on Durie Estate the Christies brought miners across from France to show the Fife people how to sink pits. The French people lived in a place called Mont Fleurie.The Leven people put the two words together and it then became Mountfleurie.Mont stands for mine and Fleur stands for flower. The Christie's of Durie were the principal landowners and one of the main streets is named after them, Durie Street.
